page.title: 13Footpaths.
page.content: To tell you there are footpaths between{Colburn}and{Easby Abbey},wide yellow arrows are painted on to gate- posts,trees or wooden stiles.Paths in the field are hard to spot because they've not been used a lot and are overgrown with grass and nettles.Most stiles are in good condition but some are broken:snapped because of weather, vandalism or neglect.When the path enters the woods,it isn't easy to see.It's muddy and there are ditches and boggy patches you have to jump across,though there is a wooden bridge over one stream.You cross some muddy parts on slippery stones and fallen trees,and in places branches have grown across the path.A gravel path from the{Iron Bridge}to the{Baths in{Richmond}is wide and straight:it used to be a railway line. (D.Melia;R.Webber;F.Grant;J.Milsom)
